page.title: 02Local History
page.content:
The Villages in which we live are all mentioned in the Domesday book of 1086.{Wykeham}-{Wicha}- as spelt in the Domesday book.This place name may have come from the Latin word{Vicus} meaning a settlement for the families of Roman legionaries and trades people which appeared near a military station ( signal station at the eastern edge of{Scarborough}castle.)
{Hutton Buscel.} Recorded in the Domesday book as{ {Hotun}- meaning High Farmstead.Other names ending in tun or ton meant lowland sites,this is the case with { {East}and{West Ayton}twin villages on the{River Derwent.}In the Domesday book{Ruston}is written as{Rostun}.
